steps: Dissolving equimolar quantity of Lanthanum (III) nitrate and Nickel (II) nitrate in glacial acetic acid

Adding 0.01 M concentration of ethylene glycol and stirring for 1 hr

Adding appropriate amount of distilled water and ethylene glycol and stirring for 30 mins
Adding 10 wt% of polyvinyl pyrrolidone and stirring for another 1 hr
Filtering using Whatman filter paper

steps: mixing and calcining MgO and Nb2O5 at 1100°C for 5 hours to produce precursor columbite
mixing and calcining MgNb2O6, PbO, TiO2, Sm2O3, and Pr6O11 at 800°C for 3 hours to generate PMN-PT powder
pressing PMN-PT powders into 13 mm-diameter cylinders by uniaxial dry pressing
sintering cylinders into ceramics in an oxygen atmosphere at 1200-1240°C
sintering under a uniaxial pressure of 100 Mpa to further improve densities and eliminate porosity

article_metadata.title: Significantly enhanced piezoelectric properties in PMN-PT transparent ceramics by Sm/Pr co-doping

steps: Ball milling of La2O3 and Nb2O5 in ethanol for 12 hours
Sieving of the mixture to prepare the LN additive
Weighing of high-purity raw powders of PbO, TiO2, ZrO2, Bi2O3, and La2O3 based on the 0.3PT–0.65PZ–0.05BLZT formula
Ball milling of the mixed powders in ethanol for 16 hours
Drying of the mixtures in an oven at 80 °C for 1–2 hours
Calcination at 820 °C for 2 hours
Secondary ball milling, drying, and sieving processes
Pressing of the granulated powders into 12 mm thick sheets under the granulation of 5 % polyvinyl alcohol
Sintering at 600 °C for 4 hours to remove the binder
Sintering at 1230 °C for 2 hours to synthesize the ceramic samples
Polishing of the ceramic surfaces to maintain a uniform thickness of approximately 0.3 mm

article_metadata.title: A-site and B-site cation doping engineering: A strategy to enhance strain in Pb(Zr, Ti)O3-based ceramics

steps: The weighed powder was ground with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 h
It was dried at 100 °C for 12 h
The powder mixture was calcined in air at 760 °C for 6 h at a rate of 2 °C per minute
8 wt% of polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) was added to the powder as a binder and pressed under uniaxial pressure of 10 MPa to form the shape of discs with a diameter of 8 mm
They were sintered at 970°C for 6 h
These samples were sintered at 600 °C for 3 h to remove the PVA
Silver paste was applied to the surfaces and fired at 450 °C for 30 min
The silver-plated ceramic samples were then polarised in silicone oil at 110 °C for 15 min using a DC field of 5 kV/cm

steps: synthesize [001]-oriented BTO template powders using molten salt method
sinter template powder at 1100 °C for 1 h
prepare BTO matrix powders by solid-state reaction
calcine raw materials at 700 °C for 2 h
ball mill calcined powder for 48h-72h
mix template and matrix powders by ball milling
add 5 vol% of BTO template to solution and stir for 1 h
perform tape casting with a blade gap of 210 μm
dry tapes at room temperature for 8-10h
cut tapes into 10 × 10 mm squares and laminate under pressure of 75 MPa for 1-3h
burn off organics at 600 °C for 3h
heat green bodies in tube furnace from 650 °C to 1000 °C at a rate of 10 °C/min
sinter green bodies in oxygen atmosphere at 950 °C for 0-6 h

drying the ball-milling mixture at 70 °C for 6 h
calcining the dried powders for 4 h at 850 °C
adding 0.2 wt% MnO2 to the calcined powders
grinding the calcined powders using a planetary ball mill for 12 h
drying the powders again
adding a 6 wt% polyvinyl alcohol binder (PVA) to the calcined powders
pressing the powders into discs under a pressure of 6–8 MPa
heating the discs at 600 °C for 2 h to remove the PVA
sintering the pellets at 950 °C-1050 °C for 2.5 h in the air

article_metadata.title: Domain engineering via liquid nitrogen quenching in bismuth sodium titanate-based relaxor-ferroelectric thin films

steps: The 0.15PSN-0.57PMN-0.28PT matrix powder was synthesized using the traditional solid state reaction method
Pure perovskite matrix powder was produced by sintering the mixed raw materials at 750 °C for 2 h
The plate-like BT templates with [001] orientation were synthesized by the topochemical transformation technique
The embryo strips were sliced, stacked, and compressed for 30 min at 70 °C with 10 MPa of pressure
The organic matters were discharged by sintering at 550 °C for 2 h
Then samples were subjected to isostatic pressing at a pressure of 200 MPa for a duration of 1 min
Finally, the sample underwent sintering in an air atmosphere at 1200–1270 °C for 0–11 h

article_metadata.title: Microstructure and electric properties in PSN-PMN-PT textured ceramics by template grain growth technology

steps: ball-milling of raw materials for 24 h
drying at 90°C
calcination at 850°C for 4 h
addition of Li2CO3 as a sintering aid
ball-milling for 48 h
drying at 90°C
preparation of BT-template-free and BT-template-included slurries
tape casting
laminating the sheets alternately

steps: Raw materials were weighed according to the stoichiometric formula

The mixed oxides were dried and then calcined at 800 °C for 6 h
After calcination, the powders were re-milled with ethanol and zirconia ball for 12 h

steps: Heating raw materials powders in an oven at 120°C for 6 h

Sieving obtained mixture by a 100-mesh sifter and then calcining at 750°C for 6 h
Subjecting calcined powders to secondary ball milling for 24 h, and then sieving through a 150-mesh sifter after drying
Compacting synthesized powders to disks of 25 mm in diameter and 2–3 mm in thickness, followed by normal sintering in air at 1108°C for 21 h in a muffle furnace
Cutting as-grown crystals from ceramic matrix and grinding into disc-like specimens with a thickness of 0.5–0.6 mm

synthesis_data.method: template grain growth (TGG) method and conventional high temperature solid state reaction method
steps: High purity powders were weighted according to the stoichiometric ratio and mixed by ball-milling in anhydrous ethanol for 24 h
The mixture was then calcined at 850 °C for 5 h to form main perovskite structure
The slurry was prepared by mixing the KNNS-(0.04-x)CZ-xBAZ matrix and NaNbO3 (NN) templates in ethanol/toluene co-solvent with polyvinyl butyral (PVB) binder and MnO2 sintering aid
The uniform slurry was tape casted to green tapes using a doctor blade with a thickness of 30–50 μm
After drying, the green tapes were cut, stacked, and uniaxially pressed under a pressure of 15 MPa at 70 °C for 20 min
After removing organic binder at 600 °C, the samples were heated to 1190 °C, and then rapidly cooled to 1090 °C and dwelled for 10 h

steps: The 0.74 Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3-0.26PbTiO3 (PMN-0.26 PT) single crystals were grown by a modified Bridgeman method.
The as-grown single crystals were oriented by the rotating XRD method, and the [001]-oriented square slices were cut with size 4 × 4 × 0.8 mmE^{3}.

In order to enhance the binding force between the single crystal and electrode, a layer of Ni was covered on the (001) plane crystal slices, and then, the Au electrode was sputtered on the crystal slices for poling and subsequently electrical performance measurement.
All samples were annealed at 600 °C for 10 h and then air-cooled to room temperature.
Meanwhile, the samples were placed at room temperature for 2 days to completely release the internal stress.
characterization_techniques: Piezoresponse force microscope (PFM, MFP-3D, Asylum Research, USA)

steps: Barium acetate, calcium acetate and tin acetate were added in 2-ethylhexanoic acid in stoichiometric ratio and dissolved by heating the mixture at 80 °C until clear solution was obtained
The desired stoichiometric quantity of C16H36O4Ti was mixed in the same solvent in separate beaker and then added to the previous solution
The final solution was then stirred and mixed for 1 h under continuous heating at temperature 80 °C
The solution was dried so as to obtain BCST powder
The BCST powder was calcined at temperature 1000 °C for 4 h in muffle furnace
The calcined powder was grinded in mortar pestle with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) solution until fine powder was obtained
The pellets of the grinded powder were prepared by compressing under 5 ton pressure
The pellets were sintered at two different temperatures 1100 and 1200 °C for 5 h in order to get densified BCST ceramics samples

article_metadata.title: Effect of epoxy resin addition on the acoustic impedance, microstructure, dielectric and piezoelectric properties of 1–3 connectivity lead-free barium zirconate titanate ceramic cement-based composites

steps: wet-mixing of Sc2O3 and Nb2O5 powders via ball milling for 12 h
calcination at 1050 °C for 6 h to obtain the precursor ScNbO4
mixing of precursors with PbO, ZrO2, TiO2, MnO2, and Sb2O3
calcination at 850 °C for 2 h to achieve the desired composition of PZT-PMS-PSN
crushing for 8 h and drying
mixing with PVA binder and pressing to form pellets

polishing to reach about 0.5 mm

Grinding in a mortar and pestle for 2 h
Milling in an ethanol solution with zirconia balls in a low-energy ball mill for 4 h
Drying and pulverization of the resulting solutions
Calcination at 1200 °C in air ambient for 4 h
Regrinding and molding into disk-shaped pellets with 1 wt % polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as an organic binder
Heating at 650 °C for 1 h to burn off the PVA binder
Simultaneous sintering at 1400 °C in air for 4 h

steps: Ball milling for 15 h at a rotational speed of 300 rpm
Addition of 2 mL of 13.8 M ammonia solution and ball-milling for an additional 3 min
Transfer of the mixture onto a silicon carbide plate
Evaporation of the ammonia solution by heating the plate on a hot plate set to 150 °C
Introduction of the SiC plate with the residual mixture into a tubular furnace
Gradual increase of the furnace temperature to 1300 °C and maintenance for 3 h under a continuous flow of NH3 gas

steps: Weighing of raw materials according to nominal composition
Ball mixing for 24 h with anhydrous ethanol and zirconia balls medium
Drying and calcining at 800 °C for 3 h
Ball milling for 24 h again
Granulation by polyvinyl alcohol solution (PVA, 5 wt%) as adhesive
Pressing into green pellets of 13 mm diameter and about 1.0 mm thick under a pressure of 120 ± 10 MPa
Firing at 650 °C for 3 h to burn off the PVA
Sintering at 1065 °C–1105 °C for 3 h in air with 5 °C/min followed by furnace-cooling to ambient temperature
